stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream reviewing and integrating Biobak’s full visual/geometry remake of Course 11 “Oily Boily Bay,” fixing materials, lighting, collision, and render-order issues. He also discusses plans for a new public demo containing only Course 1 to gather physics/camera feedback.

development_findings.summary: A new public demo will feature only Course 1 and a Google-Doc survey to gather large-scale feedback on physics and camera tuning.
development_findings.quote: I'm thinking what we should do is make another demo with just course one and then we use that to get feedback on the physics and the camera.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s remake of Course 11 reduces ~1,700 triangles, adds vibrant lighting, brutalist Bowser tower, re-textured containers, pipes, underwater factory, and refined boss arena; Kaze is importing, fixing fog/materials, and rebuilding collision.
development_findings.quote: This tower looks so cool… Alright, this is an awesome remake already.

development_findings.summary: Global render order change required: swap layer 6 and layer 5 so transparent decals render before transparent surfaces.
development_findings.quote: By setting this on layer six we actually need to swap layer six and layer five in the entire game because it makes no sense that transparent decals render after transparent surfaces.

development_findings.summary: New mechanic: holding A while bouncing on Goombas gives a higher rebound and restores air-control, emulating 2D Mario games.
development_findings.quote: So you can jump on Goombas normally, right? But if you hold the A button you jump higher.

development_findings.summary: Planned visual polish for Course 11 includes spark particles on generators, subtle light pulses, dynamic lighting above oil, elevator doors that sync with cabin, and elevator-only camera & music.
Identified soft-lock: Mario’s safe position updates while hanging on a bench; flagged for fix.
Will rebuild Course 11 collision map and fix a crash related to missing fog/material settings before public preview.
Freezie enemy model (inspired by Mario Kart DD) still in revision; Kaze unhappy with current look.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dismisses traditional ‘color theory’, preferring rational, emotion-driven choices.
context_findings.quote: The idea is you think of an emotion and then you think about how you can use the tools in your arsenal to evoke this emotion.

context_findings.summary: He views humility as unnecessary posturing; values willingness to change mind over acting humble; opposes ‘democracy’ in game-design decisions.
context_findings.quote: Acting humble is a coward's tactic. Me making every single decision ever is better than democracy for everyone involved.

context_findings.summary: Expresses excitement about current movement system: removed dead frames, improved flow; says returning to vanilla 64 feels bad now.
Personal tidbit: owns 15-30 Yoshi plushies; parents visiting next month bringing more.

biobak.summary: Delivered comprehensive Course 11 overhaul with detailed changelog, reduced polycount, new lighting/architecture, and asset packs (e.g., 11 hydraulic variants).
Suggested gameplay/FX additions: spark particles, scrolling oil, dynamic lights, elevator camera+music, Koopa hamster-wheel Easter egg controlling factory power.

key_stories.title: Oily Boily Bay Overhaul
key_stories.summary: The old Course 11 looked flat and ran poorly. Biobak rebuilt it from scratch with brutalist visuals, optimized geometry, and richer lighting. Kaze live-reviewed the file, fixed rendering quirks, and planned further polish.
key_stories.challenge: Original version lacked visual punch and strained performance.
key_stories.process: Biobak rebuilt assets; Kaze inspected in Blender/Fast64, adjusted materials, fog, and collision, and listed follow-ups (particles, lighting, decal layers).
key_stories.outcome: Remake approved; Kaze will finish technical integration and showcase the level on his main channel.
key_stories.key_quote: This tower looks so cool… Alright, this is an awesome remake already.

key_stories.title: Course 1 Demo Feedback Plan
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants empirical data to fine-tune physics and camera, so he decides to publish a stripped-down demo containing only Course 1 and a feedback survey.
key_stories.challenge: Need objective player data rather than internal opinions.
key_stories.process: Design a demo build, attach Google-Doc survey, and monitor player responses.
key_stories.outcome: Demo targeted ‘within weeks’ once Course 11 video generates hype.
key_stories.key_quote: We use that to get feedback on the physics and the camera and I think that would be fun to help us make the game more fun.

open_questions.context: Kaze’s presets vanished in Blender 4, blocking rapid material setup; neither he nor Lila could locate the folder.
questions: Where are user preset files stored in Blender 4?
Can the team standardize on a single Blender version or share a preset pack?
What pipeline changes are needed to avoid this recurring?

open_questions.context: Biobak proposed a Koopa powering factory lights; dialogue and power-down sequence discussed but not implemented.
questions: What final behavior and dialogue should the Koopa have?
How will lights, pipes, and screen overlay react?
Does this affect gameplay or purely atmosphere?

open_questions.context: Idea to add an interior camera and dedicated elevator jingle.
questions: What musical style should the elevator track be?
Will Badub compose a short loop?

open_questions.context: Transparent decals currently render after transparent geometry; Kaze wants to swap layer 5 & 6 game-wide.
questions: What unintended side-effects could this have on existing levels?

open_questions.context: Current Freezie model ‘doesn’t look very good’; Kaze still iterating.
questions: What visual references will guide the final design?
Will Zeina animate the enemy once model is approved?
